description: Sierra Leone is indefinitely closing schools and all other learning institutions as of 31st March after the recording of the country's first case of the Coronavirus. UPDATE: Sierra Leone has decided to reopen schools as follows: Pre-primary schools will reopen on 15 September 2020 and Primary and Secondary schools will reopen on 5 October 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)

description: On March 16, 2020, Sierre Leone enforces a mandatory quarantine to British Nationals and people from countries with over 50 cases of the coronavirus. The government discourages travel of nationals from these countries but if it was essential travel they would be quarantined for 14 days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Sierra Leone a travel advisory was published on the official Facebook page of the Ministry of Information and Communication announcing that "All passengers shall be subjected to a mandatory COVID-19 test upon arrival: Passengers will simultaneously have a PCR test swab and an RDT test on arrival. (...) if the RDT screening is positive, passengers will be isolated at a hotel in Lungi while waiting their PCR test result. Note, the cost of the accommodation at the hotel shall be borne by the passenger."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: Sierre Leone is enforcing mandatory  quarantine to British Nationals or passengers from countries with over 50 cases of the coronavirus from 16th March. the government discouraged travel of nationals from these countries but if it was essential travel they would be quarantined fir 14 days. UPDATE: On the 22nd of July Sierra Leone's Ministry of Information and Communication published a travel advisory stating that quarantine after travel will be based on whether you test positive to a rapid diagnostic test (RDT) on arrival.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
